title: Ancient Peaks 2014 Merlot (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Roast beef aromas make for a meaty entry on this bottling from a large vineyard in the southern reaches of Paso Robles. Black currant and rosebud scents round out the nose. Macerated black fruit kicks off the palate but begins to taste sour, while lava rock and gravel notes make for an earthy midpalate.

title: Apolloni 2015 L Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Just 10% of the blend was aged briefly in Acacia oak, and there's little evidence other than a slight hint of vanilla. What's here in abundance is bright, tart, tangy citrus fruit. It's a fresh and flavorful alternative to Chardonnay.

title: Argentiera 2014 Poggio ai Ginepri  (Bolgheri)
description: Made of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Syrah and 20% Merlot, this has black-skinned berry and baking spice aromas. The approachable palate delivers blackberry, cocoa and cinnamon notes with round, supple tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Baker & Brain 2013 Alta Loma Grenache (Monterey County)
description: This is a unique take on Grenache, showing crushed cinnamon, hibiscus and dried rose petal scents, which come across slightly muddled. The palate is distinctive, with cola and baked red cherry flavors set against an earthy, soil-laden frame, proving interesting but far from what many have come to expect from this grape at a high level.

title: Balletto 2013 Estate Grown Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's BCD Vineyard—where it also grows Pinot Noir—this bold, big-boned red is smooth, simple and soft, accented with raspberry, vanilla, lavender and mocha notes. Its acidity is subtle and supportive, providing underlying freshness from start to finish.

title: Bindella 2013 I Quadri  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: French oak, licorice and balsamic menthol notes carry over to the assertive, linear palate, where sour cherry, espresso and green sage flavors are braced by grainy tannins.

title: Romeo 2011 Riserva dei Mandorli  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: This wine opens with stewed plum, used leather, vanilla and coconut aromas. The palate is evolved, offering prune, espresso and sage flavors, with close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Kuleto Estate 2012 The Point Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine blends 6% co-fermented Syrah from a single lot, the fruit celebrated in all its ripe, full-bodied glory. Cherry, chocolate and barbecue flavors commingle on the soft, round palate that develops further richness in the glass. The tannic profile is strong and thick.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2013 Sophia's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: The nose of this bottling from one of Temecula's most reliable producers is pretty but not terribly complex, with crushed purple flower, blackberry jelly, coffee and elderflower aromas. The palate shows Concord grape fruit flavors and a gravel-driven minerality.

title: Parker 2014 Alisos Vineyard Barbera (Santa Barbara County)
description: This grape is still finding its way to consistency in California, and this bottling combines interesting black raspberry and reductive tar notes. It's light in body, with red raspberry fruit flavors and pencil shaving accents. Best served with food, since it doesn't offer a lot of compelling character on its own.

title: Stinson 2014 Chardonnay (Monticello)
description: Bright in aromas of pineapple, lemon and green apple, but also boasting sweet cream and yeastiness, this wine is layered on the nose. Zippy and fresh, with ample acidity and flavors of subdued lemon and pineapple, it's an easy wine to pair with dishes from halibut to a more robust pork chop.

title: Tahbilk 2015 Estate Grown and Bottled Marsanne (Nagambie Lakes)
description: Tahbilk's Marsanne is always difficult to evaluate young, as it's invariably rather neutral in aroma and flavor. Subtle notes of pear and marshmallow make a fleeting appearance before yielding to crisp, lemony finish. Drink now with oysters, or hold 5–10 years for greater weight, texture and versatility with food.

title: Season 2013 Malbec (Southern Oregon)
description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this medium-weight effort carries scents of tomato leaf and Mediterranean herbs. Those highlights continue into the palate, with pomegranate fruit and a dry pleasant lightly herbal character.

title: Poggio alla Sala 2012 Parceto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Fragrant blue flower, ripe black-skinned berry, rosemary and espresso aromas lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried plum, tart cherry, coffee and French oak notes, against a backdrop of raspy tannins that clench the finish.

title: Pinino 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Bright red berry, blue flower and baking spice notes lift out of the glass. Light-bodied and accessible, the palate offers red cherry and star anise flavors held together with pliant tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Podere il Pozzo 2014  Chianti Rufina
description: This 100% Sangiovese offers red-skinned berry and cooking spice aromas. The straightforward palate offers tart red cherry and wild strawberry fruit with a hint of underbrush and loose-knit tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Poggio al Casone 2015  Chianti Superiore
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with plum and violet aromas. Mellow tannins frame a palate of red cherry and baking spice flavors. Enjoy soon.

title: Fattoria di Basciano 2014  Chianti Rufina
description: Made of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this opens with black-skinned berry aromas and an earthy whiff of underbrush. On the palate, black plum, tilled soil and a hint of clove are enveloped in soft tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Domaine François Schmitt 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: An extremely fruity nose comes across as fresh and peachy. The body is less aromatic but crisp and very light. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.

title: Lazzeretti 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This shy, robust red reveals faint whiffs of underbrush, leather and Mediterranean brush. The subdued, one-dimensional palate offers raisin and licorice flavors, an alcoholic warmth and brawny tannins.

title: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2015 Vieille Vigne Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: The nose does not give a lot away and is very neutral—just a mere hint of freshness. The palate provides gentle fresh fruit and is rounded. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.

title: Mocali 2015  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Red berry, underbrush and coffee bean aromas lift out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate delivers red cherry, clove and tobacco notes, with firm tannins that grip the finish.

title: 2Hawk 2015 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: The strawberry fruit shows a wild herbal side, with a touch of toasted grain. The tannins are firm and the finish carries a hint of chicken broth.

title: Agostina Pieri 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with sun-baked soil, mocha, prune and leafy underbrush aromas. The densely concentrated palate offers black cherry jam, espresso and vanilla flavors, with scorching alcohol and assertive tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Apolloni 2015 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a light easy-drinking style that fills the quaffable white wine bill quite nicely. It's lemony and tart, with a slice of orange peel for extra interest.

title: Vecordia 2011 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Mixed berry, Christmas spice and herbal aromas have their limits. This is ringing and hard on the palate, with an unsettled combo of fierce tannins and bold acidity. Raspberry and plum flavors are on the tart side, while this runs low on cushion and depth on the finish.

title: Cantina del Giusto 2011 San Claudio II Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Made of Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Mammolo, this opens with French oak, coconut, espresso and prune aromas. The palate is lean, offering star anise, dried sage, raisin and orange zest notes rather than juicy fruit. Grainy tannins give it a bracing finish.

title: Cantine Bellini 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: This Riserva's shy nose eventually reveals black-skinned fruit and a whiff of baking spice, while the palate offers straightforward plum and clove flavors. It's easy-drinking and has mellow tannins.

title: Castro Martin 2015 A2O Sobre Lias Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melon and a green note of pole beans and lettuce set up a high-acid citric palate. Grassy notes of clover and lettuce infiltrate core citrus flavors, while this shows lemony punch and an herbal note on a juicy tangy finish.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Dampier Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: This is a pleasant bottle, with delicate fruit flavors that suggest watermelon and strawberry—nothing riper. There's a distinct impression of white balsamic vinegar, adding a high-toned lift that's just on the edge of too much, at least for some tasters.
